page.title: 11AMBULANCE SERVICE:ATTITUDES.
page.content: We interviewed 20 people in our block. Most of these people were women, presumably because the men were out working.When we asked them what they thought of the ambulance service, most people thought they were adequately served, but some said the service was disgraceful. Several of the older people we interviewed said they were sometimes worried that the ambulance would not get to them in time.When we asked them how long they thought it would take the ambulance to get to them from Alnwick, which is 3 miles away, the answers ranged from 7 to 30 minutes.We contacted the ambulance station at Alnwick and asked how long it would take to get to Lesbury, they said it would take about 7 minutes after receiving the call.
